definition: the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: King David made Hebron his capital briefly in the 10th century BC.
sentences.chinese: 約西元前10世紀，大衛王曾短暫定都於希伯倫。

sentences.english: Rome. itself. experienced a fin the morningine in the year 436 BC.
sentences.chinese: 在西元前436年，羅馬也始末過一次饑饉。

sentences.english: His book consists of four prophecies delivered in 521 BC.
sentences.chinese: 他的書包含了四篇神諭，發表於西元前521年。

sentences.english: In 61 he formed the First Triumvirate with Julius Caesar and Marcus Licinius Crassus.
sentences.chinese: 西元前61年與凱撒和克拉蘇形成三頭政治。

sentences.english: Aeschylus ' first known dramatic defeat came in 468 BCE.
sentences.chinese: 埃斯庫羅斯第一次失敗是在西元前468年。

sentences.english: In 216 he won the Battle of Cannae.
sentences.chinese: 西元前216年取得坎尼戰役的勝利。

sentences.english: The first sewers appeared in Rome around 700 B. C.
sentences.chinese: 下水道則最早出現於西元前七百年的羅馬。

sentences.english: He died at Gela, Sicily, in 456 BCE.
sentences.chinese: 西元前456年，他死於西西里島南端的小城吉拉。

sentences.english: Kang said the double-spring phenomenon had only occurred 12 times since 221 B. C.
sentences.chinese: 康說，雙春現象自西元前221年起只發生過12次。

sentences.english: The first 1)sewers appeared in Rome around 700 B. C.
sentences.chinese: 下水道則最早出現於西元前七百年的羅馬。

sentences.english: In the 3rd century BC it fought the Punic Wars with Rome.
sentences.chinese: 西元前第3世紀，與羅馬人展開布匿戰爭。

sentences.english: According to tradition, it was founded in 75 BC by Pompey the Great as a military settlement.
sentences.chinese: 相傳西元前75年由龐培創建，當作屯兵之地。

definition: Sumer (Šumer), one of the early civilizations of the Ancient Near East
Phoenicia, ancient civilization along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea
Thebes, place name in ancient Egypt/Thebes, ancient Greek city state
Tutankhamen, king of ancient Egypt 1333-1323 BC
the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
Book of Exodus/Second Book of Moses
